Identification.LongTitle: Locally Engaged Employees of the Canadian Embassy and Consulates in the United States Remission Order

Provision.Text: Her Excellency the Governor General in Council, considering that it is in the public interest to do so, on the recommendation of the Minister of Finance, pursuant to subsection 23(2)a of the Financial Administration Actb, makes the annexed Locally Engaged Employees of the Canadian Embassy and Consulates in the United States Remission Order.

Subsection.Text: The following definitions apply in this Order.

Definition.Text: Act means the Income Tax Act. (Loi)
Canada-US Tax Convention means the convention, as defined in the Canada-United States Tax Convention Act, 1984. (convention fiscale Canada–États-Unis)

Embassy or Consulate means the Embassy of Canada located in Washington, D.C., United States or any one or more of the offices of the Consulate General of Canada that are located in the United States. (ambassade et consulats)
locally engaged employee means an individual who during the taxation year

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: is paid by the government of Canada for services rendered by the individual in the discharge of functions of a governmental nature at an Embassy or Consulate. (employé recruté sur place)

Subsection.Text: Unless the context otherwise requires, words and expressions used in this Order have the same meaning as in the Act.

Section.Text: Subject to sections 3 and 4, remission is granted to each locally engaged employee with respect to tax payable under the Act for taxation years that begin after 2016 of the lesser of, in respect of remuneration that is taxable in Canada, and not in the United States, because of Article XIX of the Canada-US Tax Convention,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the amount added to the tax payable under Part I of the Act by the employee under subsection 120(1) of the Act for the taxation year, and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the amount, if any, of United States state-level income tax paid by the employee for the taxation year.

Section.Text: Remission is granted only to the extent the amount remitted has not otherwise been rebated, remitted, credited or refunded to any person under the Act, the Financial Administration Act or any other Act of Parliament.
Remission is granted to a locally engaged employee in respect of a taxation year on the condition that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the locally engaged employee applies for the remission in writing to the Minister on or before the day that is two years after their filing-due date for the taxation year; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the application is accompanied by the documentation required to determine both the eligibility for and the amount of the remission.

Section.Text: This Order comes into force on the day on which it is made.
